extracted_playbook.title: Use HMI in Protected Environment
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure HMI is used only in a protected environment to minimize network exposure and prevent access from public Internet or untrusted networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Setup Network Segmentation and Firewall
extracted_playbook.description: Implement network segmentation and a firewall to block all unauthorized access.

extracted_playbook.title: Restrict Usage of Unverifiable Portable Media
extracted_playbook.description: Limit the use of portable media that cannot be verified.

extracted_playbook.title: Restrict Application Access
extracted_playbook.description: Restrict application access to limit the transfer of firmware to HMIs.

extracted_playbook.title: Scan Software/Files for Rootkits
extracted_playbook.description: Scan software and files for rootkits before usage and verify their digital signatures.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Secure Communication Protocols
extracted_playbook.description: When exchanging files over the network, use secure communication protocols.

extracted_playbook.title: Subscribe to Schneider Electric's Security Notification Service
extracted_playbook.description: Subscribe to Schneider Electric's security notification service to stay informed about updates, affected products, and remediation plans.

extracted_playbook.title: Locate Control and Safety Systems Behind Firewalls
extracted_playbook.description: Place control and safety system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from the business network.

extracted_playbook.title: Install Physical Controls
extracted_playbook.description: Install physical controls to prevent unauthorized access to industrial control and safety systems, components, peripheral equipment, and networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Place Controllers in Locked Cabinets
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure all controllers are placed in locked cabinets and never left in 'Program' mode.

extracted_playbook.title: Connect Programming Software to Intended Network Only
extracted_playbook.description: Never connect programming software to any network other than the network intended for that device.

extracted_playbook.title: Scan Mobile Data Exchange Methods
extracted_playbook.description: Scan all methods of mobile data exchange with the isolated network, such as CDs and USB drives, before use in terminals or any node connected to these networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Sanitize Mobile Devices Before Connecting to Safety or Control Networks
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure mobile devices that have connected to any other network besides the intended network are properly sanitized before connecting to safety or control networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Minimize Network Exposure for Control System Devices
extracted_playbook.description: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the Internet.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Secure Methods for Remote Access
extracted_playbook.description: When remote access is required, use secure methods such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs). Ensure VPNs are updated to the most current version available.

extracted_playbook.title: Perform Impact Analysis and Risk Assessment
extracted_playbook.description: Perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.

extracted_playbook.title: Report Suspected Malicious Activity to CISA
extracted_playbook.description: Follow established internal procedures and report suspected malicious activity to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.

extracted_playbook.title: Avoid Social Engineering Attacks
extracted_playbook.description: Do not click web links or open attachments in unsolicited email messages. Refer to resources on recognizing and avoiding email scams and social engineering attacks.
